intro: Hedyotis cachirensis, commonly known as the Cachira bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, small opposite leaves, and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Hedyotis cachirensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
